Name: Lotus flowers in water
Description: This tile fragment is one of those tiny pieces, which hint at the beautiful way the houses and palaces of el-`Amarna were decorated. It comes from a floor or wall decoration and has a typically Egyptian motif, the lotus. In the background are schematic water lines, blue on white, and the stems and buds of popular water plants. Fragments with similar decoration are often found at el-`Amarna.
